about.heading: About âš¡ Me
paragraphs: My name is Petros Skoulas, and I'm a junior front-end web developer from Greece. After completing my secondary education at the 9th General Lyceum of Amarousion, I pursued Information Technology (IT) studies at the American College of Greece - Deree, where I specialized in Software Development and I graduated in 2020. It was during my studies that I discovered my passion for web development, and since then, I have dedicated myself entirely to front-end web development.

Driven by a deep enthusiasm for crafting smooth, visually appealing, and intuitive web experiences, I immersed myself in mastering the core technologies of the modern webâ€”HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. To stay current with the evolving front-end landscape, I adopted React, one of the leading front-end libraries, which has further refined my skills and ensured my adaptability in todayâ€™s fast-evolving tech ecosystem.

Given the widespread use of WordPress as the worldâ€™s leading CMS, I also invested time in understanding WordPress theme development. This expertise allows me to deliver custom solutions tailored to client needs while applying the best front-end web development practices. Iâ€™m highly committed to creating unique, custom WordPress themes that blend technical precision with creative design.
Equipped with a strong foundation and a constant desire to learn, Iâ€™m always eager to collaborate, tackle new challenges, and make meaningful contributions to the web development world.

core_technologies.description: Although I'm still relatively new to React, I've quickly grasped its core concepts, including React hooks, the JSX syntax, and component-based architecture. Iâ€™m confident in my ability to use React effectively in my projects and continue to deepen my expertise with each new endeavor. In fact, this portfolio website was built with React, and I have no regrets about choosing it.

JavaScript is the foundation of front-end web development, empowering developers to create dynamic, interactive web applications. Through hands-on projects and continuous learning, Iâ€™ve developed a deep understanding of its core concepts, including DOM manipulation, event handling, API integration, and modern ES6 features. Leveraging these skills, along with expertise in modern frameworks, Iâ€™m able to deliver polished, high-performance websites that offer seamless user experiences.

Though my experience with TypeScript is still evolving, Iâ€™ve gained a strong grasp of its principles, syntax, and the benefits it brings to front-end development. By integrating TypeScript into my projects, Iâ€™ve learned how its static typing and advanced features improve both code quality and maintainability, reducing errors and streamlining collaboration. Iâ€™m eager to continue deepening my knowledge of TypeScript, leveraging its capabilities to write more robust, scalable applications

CSS can be quirky (and yes, even frustrating) at times, but that's part of its charm. Despite the occasional challenges, CSS is an essential component of web development, and I genuinely enjoy working with it. Iâ€™ve developed a solid grasp of its core concepts and principles, and for me, working with CSS is one of the most enjoyable and creative aspects of being a front-end web developer.

As a CSS enthusiast, I find the Sass pre-processor (.scss) to be an invaluable tool in my workflow. While I donâ€™t frequently use Sassâ€™s more advanced features like custom functions, I love its nesting capabilities, mixins, variables, and the convenience of prefixing parent selectors. Sass also provides a better structure for organizing my styles, making my work both more efficient and maintainable.

HTML is the fundamental building block of any website or web app. While its simplicity might cause some to overlook its importance, I deeply value its role in web development. I strive to write clean, semantic HTML that adheres to best practices, ensuring enhanced accessibility, a more organized markup, and improved technical SEO by leveraging the full potential of semantic HTML tags.

WordPress, as the world's leading content management system, powers millions of websites globally, and my experience working within its ecosystem has been extensive. I am comfortable with the principles of WordPress theme and plugin development. Specifically, I have solid knowledge of classic theme development from scratch, including hooks, the template hierarchy, template tags, custom fields, custom post types, custom taxonomies, and custom queries. Additionally, I am familiar with the REST API and the fundamentals of WooCommerce. I have also gained experience with the block editor (Gutenberg) and have a good understanding of how block themes with full site editing work, along with a basic knowledge of custom block development.

Although I don't yet consider myself a backend or full-stack web developer, my proficiency in PHP, particularly within the WordPress ecosystem, is more than adequate. While I haven't built backends for web applications, I have a solid grasp of PHP's fundamentals, syntax, and even some of its nuances. This knowledge allows me to develop WordPress themes and plugins with ease.

workflow_tools.description: In almost every project I've worked on, I've used NPM via the command line to manage workflow tools like Webpack, Parcel, and Vite, as well as various project-specific dependencies. This hands-on experience has helped me develop a deep understanding of these tools and their impact on development efficiency. By mastering them, I've honed my ability to produce clean, optimized code that adheres to industry standards.

Like every developer should, Iâ€™ve immersed myself in version control with Git and GitHub, understanding their crucial role in modern software development. Through consistent use, Iâ€™ve gained proficiency in the fundamentals, allowing me to navigate repositories, track changes, and collaborate seamlessly. By harnessing the full potential of Git and GitHub, I ensure efficient teamwork, maintain clear version histories, and keep code changes organized across all my projects.

college_education.description: Although my primary focus isn't on backend or full-stack development, I had the opportunity to work on a capstone project during my college studies, where I built a basic content management system using the Django framework in Python. While my expertise lies in front-end development, this experience has been invaluable in broadening my skill set and enhancing my adaptability to diverse technical challenges.

While my expertise is primarily in front-end web development, my formal education has given me valuable knowledge in SQL databases and database design. Although I don't specialize in back-end development, my academic background has equipped me with a solid understanding of SQL/MySQL and the fundamentals of database design.

During my academic journey, I engaged in a wide variety of software development projects, including web applications, mobile apps, desktop software, and even video games. These experiences exposed me to multiple programming languages and environments such as Java, C, C#, Android Studio, Python, PHP, and JavaScript. By working hands-on with these diverse technologies, I strengthened my skills and versatility as a developer, equipping myself to face a broad range of challenges in the constantly evolving tech landscape.
